refnamediv.refpurpose: Run random generic SMB operations against two SMB servers and show the differences in behavior

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: gentest is a utility for detecting differences in behaviour between SMB servers. It will run a random set of generic operations against //server1/share1 and then the same random set against //server2/share2 and display the differences in the responses it gets.
This utility is used by the Samba team to find differences in behaviour between Samba and Windows servers.

listitem.para: Specify the user and password to use when logging on on the shares. This parameter is mandatory and has to be specified twice.
Seed the random number generator with the specified value.
Set the number of operations to perform.
Print the operations that are performed.
Backtrack to find minimal number of operations required to make the response to a certain call differ.
Specify a file containing the names of fields that have to be ignored (such as time fields). See below for a description of the file format.
Set preset seeds file. The default is gentest_seeds.dat.
Analyse even when the test succeeded.

refsect1.title: VERSION
refsect1.para: This man page is correct for version 4.0 of the Samba suite.

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: This utility is part of the Samba suite, which is developed by the global Samba Team.
gentest was written by Andrew Tridgell.
This manpage was written by Jelmer Vernooij.
